description.plain:
Alexander James O'Connor (born May 4, 1998), better known by his stage name Rex Orange County, is an English singer-songwriter.

O'Connor grew up in Grayshott, a village in Hampshire, England. At 16, when his peers transferred to the local high school, O’Connor was accepted to London’s renowned music college The BRIT School, where he began writing music.

About his stage name he said:

My last name is O’Connor and therefore my initials are OC and I had a teacher that would call me ‘The OC’… for some reason at the time, having a kind of random association with ‘The OC’ was kinda funny to me! Rex is just a name I liked….

Hyped by Tyler, The Creator and scouted by BADBADNOTGOOD for a collaboration, Rex’s songs are “sarcastic, wit-fledged and full of charming rough edges.”

His genre is a fluctuating hybrid maundering between contemporary jazz, R&B and electronic. His wide influences include Thundercat, King Krule, KAYTRANADA and Toro y Moi. According to an interview with tmrw magazine he claims:

if i could do anything close to Frank Ocean musically, then that’s it.

Rex Orange County has also made it clear he doesn’t identify as a rapper:

songs.full_title: Best Friend by Rex Orange County
songs.title: Best Friend

description.plain:
“Best Friend” is about unrequited love. The protagonist is in love with a girl and even though it should be simple for them to be happy together she just doesn’t love him back. But still they get along so well that she might ask him to stay friends.

The song is an exploration of the intricacies of love, the feeling of loss, and the warmth of nostalgia with the knowledge that the end of a  romance isn’t the end of knowing someone who you love.

songs.title: Sunflower

description.plain: “Sunflower” is dedicated to Rex’s former girlfriend Thea, who he previously lived with in South London. The song shows his complete infatuation and almost obsession for this girl. The metaphor is that she is a sunflower, which symbolizes her purity, beauty and delicacy.

songs.embed_content: Read “Sunflower” by Rex Orange County on Genius

songs.full_title: Corduroy Dreams by Rex Orange County
songs.title: Corduroy Dreams

description.plain:
Arguably one of the songs that broke Rex Orange Country into the mainstream media, “Corduroy Dreams” initially got released on Soundcloud as a part of his debut album Bcos U Will Never B Free. Subsequently, the song put him on Two Inch Punch’s radar, providing him a management team.

Furthermore, the song even caught the attention of Tyler, The Creator, who would later invite Rex to work on his debut album, Flower Boy. Funnily, Tyler even asked Rex to fly out to LA to work on the album.

During his performance at the O2 Academy in Brixton on the 26th November 2019, as part of the Pony Tour, Rex announced that this was the first song he ever wrote.
